Reviews.Title: “Great value, pretty rooms, super clean, super nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: KMfromtoronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone for 3 weeks in Feb/March and I loved it! I came to do a course and I knew nobody in Montreal but I found friends fast thanks to the people working at the hotel who were like travel guides for me! :) Like most reviews I'm reading, I wasn't expecting much because it was so cheap.. but the area is amazing, it is heart of Montreal, the people who work there are super friendly and helpful, the manager is a sweetheart and the girl who works days is SUPER nice!! There is someone at the front desk 24h, they just got a nice spa which I didn't get to use yet, but maybe next time I'll get a manicure. Anyway, the rooms are VERY CLEAN, big, modern, I love the exposed brick walls, they look so classy, and the tis are all flat screen, everything is newly renovated and looks really nice! The cleaning ladies are very friendly too and I just felt SO SAFE staying there, especially considering the fact that I was completely alone. There's no room service or fancy lobby (actually the stairs look really sketchy when you first walk in but once you're past reception it's like the place transforms into an art gallery or something (although they do have some pretty nice - and I hear expensive artwork -in the reception area, but this place is a gem and for the price and location it is a deal anyway, but the rooms are so much nicer than a lot of other places I've stayed at that were more expensive. I love this place so much I want to go back, because it really felt like home! Definitely would book again and have already suggested friends to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: MayaMace
Reviews.Content: The best feature of the hotel is the location. I don't mind that there is a sex shop next door or homeless begging for money because this is downtown.. you're going to find them everywhere. There is also a corner store and a great chain restaurant within 10 steps of the hotel doors. In 5 minutes walking time you can be at the metro station, Place des Arts, shopping mall, grocery store and Chinatown.. I must recommend a bakery called Harmonie, they have delicious chicken teriyaki buns. You can easily locate this century old hotel by it's dark red sign on Rue St Catherine. Open the front doors to see the steep staircase leading you to the lobby. You'll be greeted by friendly bi-lingual receptionists who are here 24/7. The lobby has a cozy fireplace, bathroom, large metro and city maps, ATM (which was not working during our stay) and luggage room (which we used both before and after our stay without problems). The studio rooms are in the left wing of the building, through a small yellow hallway. Reminded me very much of a bachelor apartment. First impressions: painted light yellow, wooden floors, lovely high ceilings, three large windows (facing onto dirty roof) and lack of artwork. Small, basic room with double bed, sitting chair, small kitchen table, full fridge, stove, cupboard space and basic kitchen amenities. With a closer look you can tell the room was in need of some TLC.. for example the small stains on the walls or marker written on the blankets. Bathroom was very small with full bathtub, noisy fan, lots of towels and we had basic bathroom amenities in the mirror cupboard. There were extra pillows, a blanket and a cot located in the closet. There is also controlled heating in the room which I found quite handy. I would probably stay in a different room category should I choose to stay here again. The rooms with the exposed brick look much nicer. The website does indicate that there are both smoking and non smoking rooms available. There are no balconies/terraces. Not wheelchair accessible by any means, look elsewhere if you have mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff and nice digs!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaSquirrel
Reviews.Content: Happy to have received a studio suite through Dealfind when we were planning to be in town for a concert. The room was clean, comfortable and kitchenette was fully equipped. Walking distance to everything! 20$ parking in the lot behind the hotel for the entire weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Expected bad, but got good instead”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Mags
Reviews.Content: This is a review for room 210, shared bathroom facilities. PROS: - Cost ($75 plus taxes for 2 nights through Booking.com) - Location, yes it was in the seedier part of town but Montreal has really aggressive homeless people everywhere so you can't really avoid them. Hotel is located by grocery store, convenience stores, restaurants, bus stop, Metro station, short walk to nicer parts, not too far from Old Montreal. Because of the location, there is a bit of noise coming from the street (if you want quiet, don't stay downtown!), didn't bother me much expect for the crazy guy who played his stupid drum (yes, one drum) for 15mins outside the door. - Clean. I was scared of using the shared bathrooms but it was practically spotless. There were 3 on my floor and I never had to wait to use one of them. I barely even saw any people using them. - Room. Also very clean, towels & bedding were provided, a sink was provided in the room, lots of mirrors (for ladies with hair duties), exposed brick, high ceilings, ceiling fan. It was 20 degrees (celsius) when I went and the room stayed cool. CONS: - Check-in was fast and efficient but receptionist didn't really show me where the room or bathrooms were, had to figure it out myself. - TV was not working properly, asked reception staff (there only seemed to be one staff at a time) to have a look at it, he did and said there's nothing he can do. (What's the point of advertising you have flatscreens, when they don't work?) - No soap in the shared bathrooms. - Massive rip in the screen of the window; if a large bird wanted to fly into the room, it probably could have gone through that hole. - Too many stairs. Wasn't really a problem with me since my luggage was light and I was on the 2nd floor (although, it really was the 3rd) but could be a problem with some. - Noise coming from the upstairs room. Not sure if there was construction going on, or honeymooners who didn't take a break... - Reception did not have maps available for guests Overall, this is a budget hotel so expect a budget hotel, but a very convenient, clean, and pleasantly surprising budget hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: EMMW232431
Reviews.Content: We booked this after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We just wanted a good value hotel for one night stay and use the best of our stay in Montreal, i.e. able to access to places easily. All requirements met. When we arrived though, the front impression was not very good. Didn't feel sense of security for some reason and the whole place had a kind of smell, like cigarette mixed other sort... We were first escorted to the 'cheaper' part of the hotel (there are two hotel names but in one building). The room smelled badly. So when we brought this up, they immediately changed us to the better part of the hotel and we got a very nice room, like what is it on their web site. Overall, the staff were trying hard to accommodate and to be helpful. They were friendly too. They speak English too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lot's of stairs.”
Reviews.Author: DBP_RS_BRazil
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel's location is very good, it's one block from subway access and two blocks from the supermarket and from the underground access. But the area is not the best, the hotel is between two sex shops and at night usually there are homeless people around the hotel entrance. But we haven't had problems with that. The main problem is that there're a lot of stairs to get to the reception and more stairs to get to the room. I though that wouldn't bother me but it did, it was a very big problem. The Wi-Fi worked very well, even for Skype calls. But the room was too bright, even at night, I think they need to get better curtains! The staff was not very nice. While walking in the corridors I could hear people having sex. But loud sex is not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but maintain very low expectations...”
Reviews.Author: joycee21
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - hotel is located aÂ 2 min walk away from St. Laurent Metro Station which is central to most places you'd visit in Montreal. Â It's also surrounded by a number night clubs, a strip club, a sex shop, groups of kids out late at night, loiterers, homeless beggars, every other person passing by smoking marijuana, barred up shops and broken in windows. Â St. Catherines Street was very noisy until 2 am in the morning and we repeatedly heard police sirens throughout the night.Â  HOTEL and ROOM - The hotel's front door leads to a flight of stairs and you'll immediately smell a strong scent of musky perfume. Â At the top, you will need to be buzzed in to the reception area. The entire building smells like moth balls and the odour is overwhelming. Â We opened the windows to air out our room but the smell is entrenched into the fabrics and furnitures. Â The building is old, the floor creeks, decor is cheap and wall paint is thick. Â The sink inside the basic bedroom drains slowly, the bed is firm; there is also a Â ceiling fan, a wicker chair with a dirty seat cushion and an oddly warped wooden desk. CLEANLINESS - We found pubic hair on one bed and head hair on another. The shared bathroom looked fine except there was vomit all over the tile floor. Â We informed reception that night and which brings me to the next point... SERVICE - they said they'll take care of the mess. Â By late morning around 10 am the vomit was still there, orange pile with green chunks and all its glory. Â Re. pubic hair as mentioned earlier - the person at reception smiled at me and said, "It is probably not pubic hair but head hair that got left behind in the washer..." (I took a picture of this though he didn't bother to check.) Anyway, Â I am not sure how that comment was helpful to me but he eventually gave us another room and that one had a long strand of human head hair on the pillow and some stains on the bed sheet. Â I settled with this bed for the night...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price....”
Reviews.Author: cubatravler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, it is very well maintained and clean.I have nothing but good things to say about it. I stayed in a studio apartment with a full kitchen and own bathroom. It was essentially a bacholor apartment. I highly recommend it. It is in a busy area lots of strip clubs, sex shops and restaurants. It's walking distance to everything!!! .It is located at the corner of Saint Laurent and Saint Catherine. There are a bunch of night clubs on Saint Laurent just north of rue Sherbrooke. If you take a 15 minute walk going south you are in Vieux Montreal where you can pay $5 and get a 20 minute tour of Basilica Notre Dame.You're also 1 block north of China Town. It was -18 when i was there so if you plan on going in January then bundle up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good area.”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel was modern looking and very clean. The staff was excellent, very friendly and helpful. The location is good, just enough off the beaten path, but close enough to easily get anywhere. I only thing my room was missing was a refrigerator and microwave, but in the grand scheme of things I probably wouldn't have used them much anyway. There is an adult toy store next to the hotel, but it's pretty discrete and it's not something that would ever deter me from staying here again (even if it's a family trip), after all I'm not hanging out in front of the hotel anyway. Montreal was a great city to visit and when I get a chance to go again, the first hotel I try to book will be the Hotel I'Abri du Voyageur.

Reviews.Title: “An average Guest House”
Reviews.Author: gabrieltheangel72
Reviews.Content: Being in the centre of Montreal,you pay a bit more and get a little less,which is what I would say about this hotel/guest house. It's relatively clean. The rooms are basic but ok. Would be nice if they had a lift,to save me walking up two flights of stairs with heavy luggage,but that is a minor gripe. Location is ok. Nearest metro was few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: olofhermelin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights during recent weekend visit to Montreal. My room had a double bed, flat screen tv, wood floors, exposed brick and very modern furnishings and its own bathroom. There are two parts to the hotel and I stayed in the renovated part with ensuite rooms. The hotel is small and personalble, the staff helpful and accomodating. The hotel is located smack in the center, at the corner of Ste Catherine and Ste Laurent. Getting to places was easy as there is a subway a block away. Also the airport express bus 747 stops a block away on Ste Laurent so getting to and from airport also was quick, easy and cheap ($8). The rates were reasonable. So all in all a very good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy but OK :)”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_StPete
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights in May 2011. What was good: 1) Located in the center of Montreal. About 15 mins by walk from Central station. 2 mins by walk from Metro station. 2) Very reasonable price (for Montreal) 3) Free WiFi 4) Friendly staff What I didn't like: 1) Sexshop in the same building :) 2) Not very clean room... 3) The flush in toilet was not working 4) VERY noisy room So, the impression was not very good. But it seems like one of the best offers for that price. I do not recommend this place for family travelers. I think would be ok for solo travelers and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: nkdiaz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a double room, shared bathroom. The staff were very welcoming and helpful with local information and general just very friendly and pleasant. The room was charming, having an in room sink was a bonus. TV in room with a good selection of channels in French & English. There was never a queue for the shared bathroom which was great. There is a great Vietnamese eatery, 'pho thanh long' just 5 minute walk on same street. The hotel is in good location to walk anywhere in downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: g00dt1me
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with a friendly, informative front desk staff. As other reviewers say, it is next door to a sex shop. However, the area is in transformation and not at all unsafe. We are a couple and had no problems with the area. It is close to the metro and walking distance to Old Montreal, shopping, and the theatre district. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with AMAZING staff!”
Reviews.Author: Maelle87
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 times and always enjoyed it. The bedrooms are really nice, they also have a small apartment with a kitchen and a private bathroom. They feature everything you need! The staff, and particularly the hostess, is really helpful and welcoming. They help you out if you need to find or buy something and including when you're settling down in Vancouver. The location is also really cool, close to the bus to the airport and Berry Uqam and to a subway station. There're a bunch of nice restaurants and bars around. The Art district is in development so the place is getting even nicer! I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Next Visit - Same Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GEO1234_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, and were repeatedly impressed with everything. This Hotel is Clean, Very Reasonably Priced, Well Run, and the Location is GREAT. Our room was larger than equal or higher priced rooms at other hotels in Montreal, and other cities. On a Friday or Saturday night we might ask for a room not facing St. Catharine St. Staff was knowledgeable, and friendly. The Strip Club is GONE. The sex shop remains, but is in no way sleazy. We were able to see several of the other rooms, and while some of the other rooms were smaller than ours, we would have been happy with any of them, considering the price we were charged. The only draw back is no elevator, but then this is not a high rise hotel. My wife and I are seniors, and managed quite well thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sblinco
Reviews.Content: We were a little unsure because of mixed reviews on this property, however based on the great price (compared with everything else in Montreal) and fabulous central location, we took a chance. Our 5-night stay was fine - we had a lovely large room, pretty clean, good service, bathrooms clean. The room had a funny smell, but aside from this the hotel is generally fine and we'd definitely say to give it a go. The location is safe, central and loads of amenities surround the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: PenguinLvsScifi
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, close to everything, very clean, rooms had everything we needed, honest staff and very helpful, shared bathrooms were clean andwell taken care of. All in all a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean good-looking rooms”
Reviews.Author: extentgoogle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed overnight at the hotel for three nights. It was only 105 per room with two queen beds and a private bathroom. Our floor was very quiet, something we hadn't expected from the reviews. The staff was prompt and friendly and very helpful. VERY highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardwkirk
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is its main selling point. As long as you donâ€™t mind the sex shop next door you are very central. Donâ€™t worry, the local area isnâ€™t all sex shops, you are near to lots of shops, restaurants and attractions. The Old Town is a short stroll away. It is also 20 mins walk to the Parc du Mont Royal and the train station. You are well served by transport links too. The welcome we got was excellent. We were given an overview of the area and as first time visitors to Montreal we were advised where to visit. Overall the staff did everything they could to help. The room was simple but clean and functional. The bed was comfortable and overall we were very happy. Really it had everything you needed as a base for sightseeing. The air conditioner was pretty loud. If we had been there in summer this may have been an issue. As it was, we werenâ€™t and it wasnâ€™t.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find!”
Reviews.Author: ariane a
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel....it was very clean, friendly service and feels very safe, considering the location....perfect for couples who likes to walk to explore Montreal. Rooms have a warm feeling...I will stay there again for our next trip to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “This is, from now on, my Montreal home.”
Reviews.Author: NatashiaAnn
Reviews.Content: Amazing service. Amazing room. The location is not for everyone, but was safe and quiet enough. The adult entertainment store next door was the only part that night people off, but it was a higher end variety so their clientelle were mostly curious couples or tourists. Would recommend and will be staying here again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, excellent location (if you don't mind the neighbours)”
Reviews.Author: kittykat99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of my sister. She warned us about the downstairs shop - which for us (30 somethings) was a source of amusement every time we returned back to our room in the evening. If you are sensitive about sex or have impressionable children that you don't want to explains things to - this is not the hotel for you. If you are planning on experiencing Montreal to the fullest and want a clean, well-priced hotel with friendly and knowledgeable staff in the heart of the downtown area (1 min to Place des Arts, 2 min to China town, 5 min to the bars on St. Denis) - this place is perfect. We needed ice when we were there and the reception staff gave us the ice from their own freezer because they don't have an ice machine. Wi-fi worked perfectly too. Very, very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were spacious & quiet”
Reviews.Author: Carol K
Reviews.Content: Carol & the others were so helpful at the front desk, close to metro, the neighborhood wasn't the best (sex shops nearby) but I felt safe and the rooms were very comfortable and the prices good. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much it will be a reason to come back to Montreal!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie8516
Reviews.Content: This place made our experience in Montreal wonderful. Our room was very new with exposed brick walls and hard wood floors. It was kept clean everyday by maid service. The people working were so helpful and friendly. One of the front desk people sat with us for half an hour one night suggesting restaurants in the area. Speaking of the area, you could not ask for a better location! It is within walking distance of almost anything you would want to do in Montreal. We never had to take a bus or metro to go anywhere. The "red-light" area that some people speak of is hardly noticeable. That being said, I wouldn't recommend it to people with children, but would highly recommend it to anyone who wants a nice place to stay, in the heart of Montreal for an incredible nightly rate. STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: DigitalSailor
Reviews.Content: I echo what others said. Don't be turned off by the entrance. Yes it is above sex shop and you have to climb stairs but once you reach the lobby you are warmly greeted by friendly staff and welcoming decor. Hard wood floors and exposed brick walls really make the rooms. Bathrooms are clean and look newly renovated. But what makes this place truly outstanding is the staff. We are traveling with bikes and asked about laundry facilities. There are none for guests but the woman at the front desk offered to wash them for us! They were placed neatly on our bed at no charge upon our return!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, central location”
Reviews.Author: smp1988
Reviews.Content: If you dont mind being next to a sex shop, this little hotel offers very nice rooms at an incredible price. though not huge, the rooms are well furnished and charming ,and the exposed brick is very nice. Bathrooms are nice too. front desk was very helpful- allowed us to take a long distance call in an empty room after we had already checked out, and is there 24/7. Location is very convenient to old montreal, chinatown, downtown and st-denis. Overall excellent value. Area is very safe as well.

Reviews.Title: “Just missed the boat”
Reviews.Author: bayrouni
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here based on the reviews we read on this site and because it was central and cheap. The location was very convenient and it was easy to get around (although my Montreal based friend raised her eyebrows when she heard that we were staying in that area), the room decor was simple but attractive and it was clean with a modern bathroom. The staff were fine and the day time receptionist in particular was friendly and helpful. But - and it's a big but - for anyone staying for more than one night (as we did), there are a few problems. The room was very small and stuffy - the choice was to sit in a saunalike atmosphere or freeze from an AC aimed directly at the bed. There were also workers on the roof directly outside the room from time to time so we didn't want to open the curtains. There was no kettle, the bath towels were very very small and the hallways had an overpowering smell of air freshener. It wasn't a comfortable place to come back to to chill for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great service”
Reviews.Author: snowkoan
Reviews.Content: We came to Montreal to see U2 and stayed here for a night. The location was great (close to Chinatown, metro, downtown etc...) though some might find it a bit seedy. I think we were next door to a sex shop. That being said, our room was small but clean, quiet, and we slept very well. The guy at the front desk was very helpful when we asked about nearby food and we had a good meal thanks to him.

Reviews.Title: “The best little hotel in downtown Monteal”
Reviews.Author: sun-seeker2008-09
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at this hotel with no dissappointments whatsoever and what a location - smack in the middle of everything happening downtown. Clean rooms, well appointed kitchinettes, welcoming staff, for a price I can live with. Ask Mr. Bisson to sing an operatic melody...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for young people”
Reviews.Author: JustJanetPhoenix
Reviews.Content: This one appeals to the backpacker set. It's fine for older people too but you must be fit to negotiate all the stairs, especially with luggage. The room was immaculate as was the bathroom. I'd like to take that bathroom home with me. The exposed brick wall is a nice decorator touch. The windows could use some room darkening blinds. We were there during the jazzfest and one of the venues was right outside our window. We were pleasantly surprised that the music stopped at 11pm. Canadians are a considerate lot. There is no restaurant or breakfast but you are right downtown so everything is easy walking distance.. It would be nice to have coffee available in the rooms or lobby. One of the desk clerks told me a breakfast room is in the planning stages.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: williej3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent three nights at this hotel and were very pleased with our room and the overall experience. The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating, the room was quiet and comfortable (and clean), and the location was pretty central. I definitely recommend getting a room away from the street if possible, as there can be a lot of street noise. Overall, it would be hard to beat this place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gkra51
Reviews.Content: Everything's been said already in other reviews, but to repeat yet again: Great location, (especially for the Jazz Festival), perfect price, friendly and helpful staff. Exceeded expectations in regard to cleanliness and room size. Not a place to go for a luxury retreat, but if you want to spend a weekend in the city and save your money for worthwhile activities, book a room here. Parking garage in the area charged $11 per night

Reviews.Title: “F1 Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MaxK4
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and responsible staff. Great location, near many attractions. Safe environment. Very quiet. It was very easy to spot the hotel since it was my first time in montreal. I would recommend a different mascot/logo since current one looks a bit irrelevant and scary. I had a great time and didn't experience any problems at all. I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value....great location”
Reviews.Author: michael147275
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal with friends for the Grand-Prix. We stayed at the Abri du Voyageur hotel and was very impressed. The section of the hotel that we stayed in had been recently renovated and the rooms were beautiful, clean and comfortable. The staff was most helpful and the location of the hotel ideal to go to the races or visit the city. And all this at a cost we could afford. I highly recommend this hotel and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GoMclaren
Reviews.Content: Staff: Our trip to Montreal was wonderfully easy because of the hotel. The front desk staff was always there and very accommodating. They let us use the dryer after the F1 race to dry our clothes that were soaked from the rain even though I'm not sure that guests are technically supposed to use the laundry room there. The staff did everything they could to make the customers happy and it was a wonderful trip because of that. Location: The metro is right there if you have a longer distance to go, but it is also walking distance to the busier parts of town. The metro is wonderful, by the way. very clean and very efficient and you don't feel like as much like a sardine as you do in NYC. The Room: The room we had was obviously an old apartment that was renovated, so I loved that we had a fridge and a freezer for our drinks (we had gone F1 weekend, so keeping a cooler with drinks was much cheaper) as well as our own bathroom (which is hard to find in this price range in an old city like Montreal). Parking: There is a lot right next to the hotel but it isn't free (i believe it was 10$), but there is also a parking garage in walking distance that was a little cheaper. WiFi: its is available to guests and when your not from Canada, its wonderful to have a hotel that offers that so that you don't get charged with outrageous roaming data charges. Warning: Just be aware that Montreal is all hills and stairs (it is a mountain). The only way to get to the lobby was to go up a flight of stairs. Our room (after we had checked in) was up 4 stairs and down 4 stairs and all the stairs are different sizes because the buildings are so old. It wasn't just them that had that, but I wanted to make sure you knew that before you show up with 10 bags and then realize you have crazy stairs to climb. and yea, that's the worst thing i could say about this hotel...that they had stairs...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: s-h-slater
Reviews.Content: Location The hotel is located right next to a sex shop, so if that kind of thing bugs you then this hotel is probably not for you. Didn't bug us at all however, it was just like any other store. It is located right downtown at St.Catherine & St.Laurent, so a busy area, which is a plus or minus depending on what you're looking for. We had tickets to a multi-day concert festival nearby at the Metropolis, and could walk there in two minutes, which was a major plus for us! The mall, complete with grocery store was just a short walk West and wasn't too far for us to walk right down to the waterfront. The subway station (St.Lauent) was very close as well, so if you wanted to venture further than walking distance it would be quite easy. The building across the street, and a lot of St.Catherine were under construction, so there was a little bit of construction noise, but it wasn't very noticeable to us. I guess whatever goes into the building across the street might make a difference as well. Staff The staff at reception were very friendly and courteous. The reception is manned 24hours, and you don't get in unless they buzz you, so we felt very safe about that. Room We stayed in one of their studio apartments because we wanted the kitchen facilities. It was on the second floor, and you have to go up and down stairs to get there, which is not a problem for us - good exercise ;) The room was VERY clean, even the bathroom (other than the shower curtain, but that's forgivable). It was bright, nicely painted with big windows that open. It could get very hot (I think due to the side our windows were facing), but had a good air conditioner to turn on whenever we wanted. Had a great kitchen with all pots, pans, dishes, cutlery included. The kitchen had a full oven/stove, microwave, full size fridge/freezer, toaster, kettle and coffee maker. The bed was comfortable, and had an extra blanket and cot available. There was a shared iron & board in the hallway which I did borrow one day. And free WIFI - very important :) We were very comfortable here, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JTRobertson
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel l'Abri du Voyageur were universally courteous, friendly and helpful. Excellent suggestions for places to see and things to do (thanks, Dave!), were perfectly matched to our interests. The hotel is charming and quirky, neat and clean, and very affordable. Nightlife in the neighbourhood is ... colourful. If you're not too worried about what happens outside the walls of your hotel, this is an excellent find! Walking distance to many downtown Montreal destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, loud but cheap”
Reviews.Author: M0vinOn
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is located right next to the red light district of Montreal, and is above a sex shop. So despite climbing over passed out drunks as you exit the place, it's very close to the theatres, Chinatown, the Latin Qtr, the Plateau, Mt Royal. We stayed on the third floor above street level (the second of the hotel). The sound insulation is poor. The old flooring of the stairway and the hallways is very creaky, and even respectful guests make quite a bit of noise moving around. The noise made by the "woo girls" who seemed to be the most common hotel guests here was unavoidable. They sat around the halls and talked loudly to all hours. Not to mention the pervasive smell of cigarettes when you're trying to sleep (woo girls on the fire escape? coming up from the street? we weren't sure). There was no air conditioning in our room, so our only choice to avoid sweltering at night (bear in mind it's been a very cool spring - cold on the street) was to leave the street facing window open. Worst couple of nights' sleep I've ever had. On the plus side, the staff is generally pleasant, the place is clean and the laundry service was punctual. But the price we paid wasn't any cheaper than an HI and I've slept far better at any other hostel I could name. L'abri translates as "shelter" which was not our experience at all. We didn't feel sheltered at all from the noise of the street, the cigarette smoke, rowdy guests and creaky building. If you're a woo girl on a budget or can sleep in a sweat-box filled with cigaretter smoke, then the price is right. I shall never return....

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: bailey022
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Abri du Voyageur for 3 nights in April. After reading some of the reviews I was a little bit worried about the hotel but I have to say that everything was perfect! We stayed in the newer section of the hotel in a superior two queen room. The room was beautiful with an exposed brick wall and a large bathroom. The room was cleaned every day. The location can't be beat. It is within walking distance to most Montreal attractions and basically across the street from the metro station. The hotel staff is great. The hotel is in a bit of a "shadier" area of downtown Montreal so some people might be a little uncomfortable. I am from Toronto, so it was not a problem for me. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Azeret
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a number of times and for some reason never got around to writing a review. First off â€“ this is not a luxury hotel so if that is what you are looking for please look elsewhere. This is perfect for those looking for budget accommodation at a good price. The location is central and close to everywhere you need to go in Montreal (although be advised that it is located in the â€œred lightâ€� area of the city right near the many strip clubs and sex shops). The staff are always friendly and helpful, and there are often a few colourful characters hanging around, but I have never experienced any issues (I have stayed her about 5 times). I highly recommend the self-contained â€œstudioâ€� apartment type rooms that come with a kitchen! I have recommended this hotel to many friends and will continue to do so without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jordan2586
Reviews.Content: My stay at Abri du Voyageur was awesome, the staff was really, really helpful and there was someone at the front desk at all times which i liked, they were really knowledgeable. My room was very nice especially for the price. All in all i had a great time. I went to Montreal for a concert at Metropolis and the hotel was perfect, it was like a block away, which is what i really liked. I was close to everything. I will definitely be coming back and i'll be recommending this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location at St Laurent”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTraveler07
Reviews.Content: Very Good and helpful staff. The rooms are clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: littleboetie
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided we didn't need a fancy hotel to stay at during our trip to Montreal, just a simple place to sleep. Hotel l'Abri du Voyageur gave us just that. We chose a room with a shared bathroom, which was only a problem when both bathrooms on the floor were occupied (there were about 6 rooms on the floor, though not sure if any of them had a private bathroom). Luckily there seemed to only be one or two other rooms occupied on the floor. The room was pretty small, having just enough space to fit the bed and have two feet around it. The TV looked like it was from the '80s, with a basic antenna on top which didn't work very well. The basin in the room was convenient for getting ready in the morning and such. The wifi worked at a decent speed, and the reception desk was very helpful with everything. Parking was only a few minutes away, and ended up only being $20 for our three day stay! One issue with the room was the smell of smoke which seemed to waft up from the smoking rooms below. seems like they should have the non-smoking rooms below the smoking rooms... The location was perfect! Granted there was an adult store right next door, and strip clubs one street over, but it honestly didn't affect our stay at all. It was about a thirty second walk to the heart of downtown. All in all, this was a decent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “clean, spacious, nice”
Reviews.Author: duckster68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights without major issues. The room was very clean, spacious (two queen beds), seemed having been recently renovated, situated at the back on the main level. two minor negatives; 1. a number of young men (some drinking beer from cans) hanging around at the bottom of the main staircase and in the lobby of the hotel during the night. They seem to be the friends of the reception attendants. 2. the cleaning staff made a lot of noise despite the notice on our door "please do not disturn" in the morning, as we were trying to sleep in. Perhaps they wanted to wake us up, so that we would leave and they could make up theroom. but in general, we were happy with our stay and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jeninuk
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to most attractions or metro, which is important in winter! For central montreal, the hotel was great value, and cheaper than a private room in most hostels. Unfortunately they were renovating, and wifi was down, otherwise I would've given them 5 on all accounts. As a solo female traveller, the sex shop next door didn't bother me, I felt safe, maybe it's different in summer. Staff are friendly and helpful. For what I paid, this hotel exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KathleenHodgson
Reviews.Content: My stay was all that I needed and more. The new remodeled rooms are very nicely decorated & very clean. The room was only exceeded by the staff.... everyone was helpfull and friendly. It is very close to the metro subway station, I could get every where I in the city with ease. Highly Recomended!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms in Shady Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel l'Abri du Voyageur for only one evening, upon deciding to change our reservation for another hotel. We originally planned to stay for a few days. On the positive side, the rooms themselves are very clean and nice. We enjoyed the exposed pipes along the wall and hardwood floors. We were in the renovated part of the hotel, with a nice flat screen TV. As well, the bathrooms, though small, were very clean. Yet, it was a little odd to have the toilet and the shower/sink in a separate room on opposite sides of the guest room. The bed was fine. On the negative side, this is in the shadier part of town. As others have said, the hotel is in the "red light district" (e.g., adult stores, adult theaters) and though that may not necessarily be a bad thing for everyone, for others (like us), it is a little jarring. We also noticed some lone guests coming into the hotel very late in the evening (who seemed to just be staying for a few hours, but we can't be sure) and there are loud bar patrons who are right outside of the hotel. We stayed at the front of the hotel and with the large windows right near the bed, we could hear everything from the streets, all of the conversations, as well as loud music. It was extremely difficult to sleep. As well, there is no apparent elevator in the hotel, so dragging your bags up a rather winding staircase with no assistance from the hotel staff was difficult. In general, the rooms were fine and the staff are reasonably friendly. Yet, the location of the room and the difficulty in actually sleeping there due to the noise should be concerning to some. In the end, the value of the hotel should give an indication of what you're actually paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: roamingjode
Reviews.Content: on the approach you start to get that dreaded feeling as you have to walk past graffiti and some colourful shops. but once inside it is very welcoming, very clean, and brilliant rooms for our budget. really nicely refurbished quite recently. excellent location for the bus station, rail station, shops, harbour and places to eat. the colourful area is not as bad as you might fear either. only downside - no lift and reception is up a flight of stairs i would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise!”
Reviews.Author: cajc448
Reviews.Content: Super clean, great service, convenient location, all for an awesome price! We had low expectations as this hotel was cheaper than the average hostel but it turned out to be great. The staff were very accommodating, providing us with a laundry service (instead of lugging our clothes to the laundromat), refrigerating our food for us, and storing our bags outside of check-in/check-out time. They were very friendly and kind. The rooms and shared bathrooms were very clean. Staff cleaned each room and bathroom daily and even washed the outer stairs leading up to the hotel almost daily. A quote from my fiance when we first arrived "the dirtiest thing in that bathroom is me." The room we had was quite small but it had a large closet (even with an extra cot), desk, chair, dresser, sink and mirror. The room was supplied with fresh towels so although we did not have an in suite bathroom, we had a sink and mirror with a full bathroom just across the hall. This hotel is located right above two sex shops and right next door to probably three stripper joints, not the classiest neighbourhood but we felt very safe, it isn't sketchy also, about 5 blocks away in every direction you are in a great neighbourhood..old montreal, chinatown, saint laurent/the plateau, downtown shopping district, saint denis/latin quarter. We walked everywhere from our hotel and really loved that it was a continent location. There were some small annoyances, most rooms are non-smoking but there is smoking in some areas of the building, shared bathroom is inconvenient, there was construction on Saint Catherine St outside the window..but overall this was a great budget hotel and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything more!!”
Reviews.Author: dan_8951
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is what I was looking for: Excellent Old Montreal location, hospitable/informative service, comfortable bed, and most importantly it was clean. Since no experience is perfect, my only complaint was an extremely rude 20-something French female, probably about to have her period, operating the front desk during my morning check-out...But don't let this be a damper on staying at a place that gave me the best bang for my buck. Will return!!

Reviews.Title: “So helpful, I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: danamiele
Reviews.Content: I would suggest staying in this hotel. The costumer service was excellent. If you needed help getting to small quirky places around town they know it, and will tell you how to get there. If you want to get to large popular places, they know all of those as well, of course. The bathrooms, though shared, were usually vaccant even for a busy travel season. Not to mention the bathroom was cleaner than my own clothes. There was temporary construction but nothing a closed window couldnt fix. A five minute walk in any direction took you to a lovely place in Montreal. Clean rooms, accomodating, very kind. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: miguellaurier
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four nights and was very pleasantly surprised. Though the area is presently undergoing some renovations and the street is presently difficult to manoever, the hotel is ideally situated to discover Montreal. The hotel itself has undergone some renovations and my room was in the new wing of the hotel. The room was beatiful with wooden floors, brick walls and very well appointed. The reception staff was exellent and made me feel very welcome. I highly recommend this hotel for its excellent location, great staff and fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting piece of Montreal culture”
Reviews.Author: thereviewisinn
Reviews.Content: Hmmmm what can i say....let's just say that if you are looking to take a walk on the wild side with montreal night life it is literally at your door step...however the metro is close to get you anywhere else you may desire in a hurry... what you need to know is, don't pack a large suit case with any thing heavy lots of stairs no help...door service was slow with a guest of the hotel getting uncomfortably close turned out he was a doctor but i wasn't there for an examine ... however once i arrived to my room and shut the door it was quiet and clean the basics everything that was needed on the larger side..the room is good for an over night or two perhaps but for a more comfortable relaxing time i'd choose someplace else...they did allow a later check out with no service charge ..so all and all good ...

Reviews.Title: “There's a lot to love about this place, but we probably wouldn't come back”
Reviews.Author: Juud1014
Reviews.Content: I read both the positive and negative reviews about this place and decided to give it a shot. First, the positives: its located right in the heart of Montreal, in a very lively neighborhood. Given its location, the rates are really good. Our room (a small self-contained apartment with a small kitchen) was clean and nicely decorated and had everything you might possibly need. The one big downside was that the room directly faced the street and the old windows didn't provide very good sound insulation. There was a lot of street noise from people walking around until the wee hours of the morning. Also, the street in front of the hotel, two sides had been closed off for road construction, and every morning some big piece of machinery would start tearing up the road right next to the hotel, scooping up big chunks of asphalt and loudly dumping them into a dump truck. So between the loud people outside until 5 a.m. or so and the road construction that started at 7 a.m., we didn't get all that much sleep. We would have requested a different room, but we know the hotel was full, so we suffered through it. In retrospect, I think I would have looked for a hotel that was somewhat outside the city but close to a metro station. If really do want to stay here, make sure you book a room that faces the back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “I Recommend Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: cm514
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s Like Thisâ€¦ Great price, great location for all that urban Montreal has to offer visitors. The rooms do have exposed heating pipes and electrical conduits and some slanted ceiling, but to me this beats corporate cookie cutter hotel/motel chain rooms(and prices!) any day. Room clean and cozy, shared bathrooms very clean and well tended to. I stayed three nights and had no problem with noise (inside or from street outside). The staff is absolutely friendly and helpful, I found their English to be perfect to passable (Unfortunately Iâ€™ve forgotten all my high school French). That said, there are some things that should be known before reservations are made for those who might find them unacceptable. The Abri du Voyageur is definitely running a â€œhot sheetâ€� operation (but not a brothel as one reviewer described). Mid- level prostitutes (not high price escorts but not crack hoâ€™s either) do bring in their clients for use of some rooms on an hourly (or less) basis. These rooms though are right near the front desk and access to them is directly to the lobby where guests check in and out. So persons checking in or coming and going after 10PM might cross paths with the working girls, but from what I saw they go about their business without interaction with other guests. Also if you do see them itâ€™s only in this lobby, nowhere else on the three floors of rooms. Morning, days and early evenings they arenâ€™t around. As far as the neighborhood, there are strip clubs and sex shops, but Canada isnâ€™t the US crime against person and red light (district) are not synonymous. So just look the other way if it bothers you, the neighborhood is quite safe even after Midnight (you wont get mugged). There are pan handlers around, but not particularly aggressive or threatening. Bottom line: If you are not too prudish, are able to accept bare bones but clean and functional accommodations, like or at least can tolerate saving significant money compared to other hotels in the area â€“ the Abri du Voyageur is for you!.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and cute - a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TMinx
Reviews.Content: This place had personality by the bucket-load! We loved it. Having read various reports of it being in a dodgy/red light district, we were a little apprehensive, but it was absolutely fine - in fact, Montreal feels like an incredibly safe city overall. On first impressions of our room, we were inclined to smirk a little - not a single flat surface was level (floors, walls, ceiling etc) but it didn't matter really. It was clean, comfortable and the exposed pipework added to the charm. The TV had shocking reception but as another guest has said, with Montreal on your doorstep, who needs TV!! Our only other complaint was that the airconditioning unit was incredibly noisy and not all that effective, but staying out to enjoy the night life and few beers aided our ability to sleep just nicely! The shared bathroom was right outside our door and was, like the room, a bit odd, but perfectly serviceable. The shower was tiny wee, but the bathroom itself was a huge long room, almost a corridor! All part of the charm :-) The staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful, and overal, our experience here was very good. I'd recommend this to those with a bit of an adventurous spirit and an intrepid attitude to travel. It's got everything you need, in a great location with tonnes of personality.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right!”
Reviews.Author: jacionasty
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed a clean, comfortable and affordable hotel for the July 4th weekend. We, as Americans, wanted to escape the hustle and bustle of NYC and ventured north to Montreal. This hotel had good reviews and was extremely affordable. I'm sure the prices fluctuate based on the season, but we paid about $65 per night with a shared bathroom. I thought it was a small hotel with only a few rooms, but it is actually much bigger. We were only able to book a smoking room, but didn't smell anything as I'm very sensitive to cigarette smoke. The room was located on the second floor. Check in was easy and the person at the front desk polite. They recommended we park a a garage about a 10 minute walk. We would have had an easier time parking our car but the International Jazz Festival was basically at their front door. (GREAT location is you're looking to go to this). The room over looked the main street, which worried me due to the noise outside. However, the windows are double glass - we couldn't hear a thing! The room was really cute too, with exposed brick, and vintage looking furniture. The bed was comfy and clean. There was a sink in the room too, which made our stay easier with shared bathrooms. There were 3 really nice bathrooms on our floor. Only on our last day when we were checking out did I have to use one of the bathrooms further away from our room. We kept using the one right outside our door. Note that the other bathrooms were about 10 feet further, so its really not a big deal. The maids were really polite and offered fresh towels every day. They even provide little soaps, shampoo and conditioner - something we didn't use since we brought our own. but it goes to show that they're trying to be a nice little hotel. It was definitely a step above a hostel. I really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend going. It's really a no-thrills place, but its clean, comfy and located in a great spot to check out downtown and the old city. We walked everywhere! We LOVED Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay during the Montreal Jazz Festival”
Reviews.Author: stalbansroamer
Reviews.Content: We spent two very pleasant days at L'Abri du Voyageur during the International Jazz Festival. Two open air venues were minutes from the hotel, but we were not disturbed at all. The rooms were tastefully decorated - varnished wooden floors with art hanging on the wallls and some interesting pipework which added to the decor. Only a basin in the room but palatial marble-decked bathrooms were close by. The centrally located hotel is a block from the bus stop to Pierre Trudeau airport and just a few blocks from plenty of restaurants and bars up on Boulevard St Laurent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Only fault in the room was the TV was old with a very poor signal, but with Montreal just outside the hotel, we didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “YES.......Great staff. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Meredith11
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel, simple yet clean.... and in a great location for seeing Montreal. I never write reviews but I am moved to write about the friendly staff who work here. I arrived tired and hot. When they saw that I was older than many guests there, they upgraded my room when the other available rooms might be more difficult. They answered my tourist questions. I have never had a need for an iron but I did and it was quickly provided, in fact I then found out they were in each hallway! So, if you are looking foir a budget hotel, convenient and friendlly, I highly reccomend this place. It may seem a bit strange to lodge above a sex shop and between tattoo parlours, but it goes fine for this almost 60 year old woman..

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located at Montreal's crossroads!”
Reviews.Author: gothic
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio apartment room 4, which was located at the back of the building. The only negative I would say is trying to bring a heavy case up the stairs, which I luckily had help with from a local friend. Yes it is located next to a sex shop and if I had seen it from the outside I probably would have been put off - and I'm VERY glad I wasn't. The room had a comfortable double bed, a kitchenette with table and chairs, a t.v., plenty of wardrobe room, and a small bathroom with bath and shower. It had good heating which I could alter myself and air con. Free Wi-fi which had excellent reception. The bed was made regularly and the room tidyed by the maids regularly. The desk was helpful if I had enquiries or needed anything. In short it had everything I needed for my stay here - an absolute bargain for the price. If you are looking for frills stay elsewhere - but if good basic hotel centrally located is what you seek, then look no further. No breakfast, but then so many food places nearby and having a kitchenette that's no problem. The supermarkets are expensive compared to the UK but wonderful produce. Try St. Huberts for chicken dishes and in the local take aways poutine and beaver tails as (high calorie!) snacks - yum! Pitta pit is great for sandwiches and even subway is way better than the uk version. Micobreweries for real ales and Fouffes for a rock nightclub. Fab. The hotel was situated so that if when you leave the front entrance and turned left you came to somewhat of shall we say the wrong end of town? Turn right and it was shopping and respectability. I went both ways without harm and enjoyed every moment. There was a side enterance once I had signed in which is the door I mostly used and friends could come and have time with me when ever I wished. The metro was a very short walk and everything I wanted was in a relatively short distance. I only hope to be able to return and yes I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice!”
Reviews.Author: sun-seeker2008-09
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go to Montreal., and that's usually once a year for the past 15 years, I book a room at this hotel... I LOVE Montreal - the food, the festivals, the shopping, the cultural events and performances! and since that's what I go for, I could not ask for a better location! Everything I want is walking distance from this hotell! I have done solo trips, and trips with friends and with partners.... In every instance, all greatly enjoyed their "first" experience to Montreal because, after the first day, they could get around on their own. Montreal is such a metropolitan of activity, there are always people around!. During the festivals, you'll see families still out there at 10 to 11 o'clock at night, and even if there are the "unsavory" characters as well as "sex" shops or clubs, most people walking around are just local workers or tourists that you can't help but feel SAFE! As to the hotel itself, the service is great! The reception staff are always most welcoming and are very knowledgeable as to the activities or places you might want to go to to make your trip extra special! The rooms are kept CLEAN and so are the shared bathrooms. Lately though, I've been staying in the studios as I tend to stay for ten days or so, and I like to have my coffee and toast/or bagel at my leisure before getting ready to go out for the day.... The hotel does not have all the ammenities of a Hilton, but it is quaint and has a distinctive charm that makes your stay one that is not only affordable, but historical as well. However, since it is an older building, you might want to use an I-Pod with ear plugs to get a good night's sleep, since the outside crowds can keep you up later than you would like....

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Athina078
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better. The service was great. Room was lovely and clean. However, the corner of Ste Cathrine and St Laurent goes all night. It was so noisy, we could not sleep. I highly recommend this place, but suggest you ask for a room on the other side of the building not facing these streets.

Reviews.Title: “Studio apartment was great”
Reviews.Author: OntarioKiki
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in a studio apartment and it was a great experience, because it was like having our own apartment in Montreal for the weekend. We had a separate entrance to access the apartment and the apartment had all the amenities we needed - a small kitchen, eating area, private bathroom, and a bed. Perfect for a weekend get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, centrally located, clean - what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: elfsinger
Reviews.Content: First the one negative: it's surrounded by strip clubs and sex shops, so if you have kids or are easily offended, don't stay here! Now the outrageous number of positives: if you book ahead with the web deal it's insanely cheap compared to anything else. It's located walking distance to a huge number of tourist attractions, and it's .5 block from the Metro station if you need to go further. The staff have been very friendly, and finding out it was our first trip to Montreal have made sure we knew about all the places we should go see. Parking is right around the corner in a guarded lot, and only costs $12 CAD a day. The rooms are lived in, but clean, with a sink and towel racks in the room itself. The bathrooms are huge and clean and well lit. The heat works very well. There is free Wi-Fi with a strong signal. It is an area that gets a little rowdy at night, so sleeping with the windows open is definitely out, but each room has an A/C in the window. Oh, and bring your own alarm clock - that isn't provided. All the other usual stuff is. I would definitely stay here again, if coming to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't You Just Love A Bargain”
Reviews.Author: HimalayanQueen
Reviews.Content: First let me say I am used to traveling alone and all over the world. I am a (young) 45 year old female business owner that is in shape. You'll understand shortly why this info is important. I found this hotel on the Web. I shop first location then for price when looking for a hotel. I dont like spending a lot of money on a hotel room because you only sleep and shower there (at least that's all I usually do!!!) This place was less than half the price than the other hotels. And in my opinion well worth it. I did read the other reviews on TripAdvisor and I want to address both the bad and good that other people had to say. Its always intersting that people can have such conflicting opinions but be in the exact same place. Some times even at the same time!!! I wanted a hotel that was close to everything so I could walk. This hotel is centrally located: it is about a 10 - 15 minute walk to Old Montreal, 10 minute walk to the Quarter Latin/Chinatown and 10-15 walk the other direction to all the shopping. (OMGoddess is there SHOPPING! it is dizzying!) For what I wanted to do on this first trip to Montreal this hotel was perfectly located. Now - just where it is located: right on St Catherine and yes, people, there is a sex shop next door (I took a picture for you to see). And an Opera across the street. And Plaza de la Arts on the next block. If that is going to freak you out then stay someplace else. Yes, people brought children into the hotel. We all lived. The reception desk is on the second floor. You do have to go up two flights of stairs to get into the hotel. You will have to go up two or three flights of stairs to get to your room. This was not a big deal to me as I exercise for a living. To many people it would be a big deal to not have an elevator. I suggest you start a regular exercise program - then you'd have no issues with a few stairs. The room was clean. I did a shared bathroom which was clean as well. And so was the bathroom below which I used if someone was in the one next to my room. I would stay here again if I came to Montreal. The staff was very nice and friendly. And no, the place was NOT A BROTHEL. If it was I certainly didn't notice. And it certainly didn't affect (effect?) me if it was. If you want a fancy hotel, with an elevator, a spacious room with expensive linens, lotions and potions and fancy soaps, etc. this is NOT it. But you aren't paying for that either. So please don't complain if that isn't what you get. HELLO!!!!!!! Parking was not available on site. There is a $10 outside lot you can park in. I have a BMW so I chose to park in the Plaza De Arts secure underground lot for $15 a day located 1 1/2 blocks away. (Note: you cannot get into this parking area on Sundays to park but you can get out!! CASH ONLY) You can unload your luggage in front of the hotel then go park your car. Be sure to eat at Boccacino's on McGill College - awesome food both breakfast, lunch and dinner. And right next door is Les 3 Brausseurs (spelling) great beer and great food! Old Montreal is really beautiful. I enjoyed the shopping on rue St Paul much more than all of the junk stores in many of the underground areas. Sitting in the park is quite pleasant. I can't tell you about nightlife because I have been there, done that 15 years ago and I'm not interested in doing it again. Montreal is an extremely easy city to navigate. I used a map. No problems what so ever. You can get this map at this hotel. I hope folks find this review helpful. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Everything alright”
Reviews.Author: smuutje
Reviews.Content: Nice place, right in the center of the city. It's a great place, since it is located right at the main road, you go for shopping or dining. Even night entertainment is all around. Rooms are ok, nothing fancy, everything is rather old, but everything is clean, bathrooms are recently renovated. So it is nothing special, but for that price everything is alright.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget location”
Reviews.Author: mrb247
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Grand Prix, and you can't beat the location for the price. Metro and bus on the block, or walk to the downtown shopping, Chinatown, trendy restaurants up St-Laurent or Vieux Port. If all you need is a place to rest your head at night because you'll spend the whole day touring the city, this hotel cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight getaway on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Pennden
Reviews.Content: Visiting friends in Vermont...We drove up for an overnight stay and grabbed the last room available here. My friends had stayed there before. The 3 of us shared one of the "suites" that have small kitchenettes included. For our purposes the hotel was great - within walking distance to everything we did - dinner, drinks, clubs, etc... Was great for a quick getaway on a budget. We certainly had no grand expectations, but the service was friendly and the room was comfortable. Did not notice any loud neighbors, and our room did not overlook a street. The window a/c unit was great white noise.

Reviews.Title: “It is actually a brothel!!!”
Reviews.Author: toro99
Reviews.Content: At first I thought it was a great price for a hotel...Ok let's try it...but I when I walked in (the front entrance) I saw two prostitutes walking down the stairs. I promptly walked out... I continuously saw prostitutes walking in and out and hanging around the entrance to that hotel. If you don't believe me, just pass-by there around 6 a.m. every morning.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelleredm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Abri du Voyageur every summer for the past 13 years. I have travelled the world and have stayed in low budget to five star rated hotels. All I can say is that I have consistently been thoroughly impressed with this fine boutique hotel. What I have enjoyed about the hotel is the European feel it has...reminiscent of stays that I have had in Paris and Rome, with shared bathrooms on every floor. Yes, the bathrooms are shared, but I have never once felt that they were unsanitary or lacked "hot water", etc. I find that this hotel is fantastic for people of all ages and backgrounds, and since many European travellers stay here, it is a fantastic opportunity to meet new people from all over the world. The staff at the Abri du Voyageur hotel are fantastic--from the front desk staff, Carole, Nicolas and Diane in particular to the cleaning staff, Sylvie, Veronica, etc. As you can see, the staff put in the extra effort to make you feel like the Abri du Voyageur is a home away from home--so much so that they consistently remember my name when I walk in the door, ask what I was doing during the day, and make suggestions of daily and evening activities. Yes, the Abri du Voyageur is located in an area that historically has been rated as a "red light district"..but the area is changing drastically. I've actually enjoyed staying here because this area has been extensively written about by famous Quebec playwrite Michel Tremblay as "La Main"...this is a very historical area. With the changes in the area, this hotel is located right in the middle of the entertainment district. The last time I stayed here, I decided to stay in one of the studio apartments. How lucky was I to be able to walk out of the building and right into the middle of Les Francofolies, a French Canadian musical festival...right outside the door! I really don't understand people's lower ratings of this hotel. As I have said before, this hotel has a very European feel about it..and it is inexpensive. Really, I can't understand when people have five star expectations for a lower budget hotel. In all, as I have said, I truly feel that the Abri du Voyageur hotel is a wonderful place to stay in Montreal...it is in an amazing location...right in the middle of everything. If you are willing to be open-minded and open to having an fantastic time, then this hotel is for you! Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: YvonneRoma
Reviews.Content: L' Abri du Voyageur is a funny place in downtown Montreal, where to spend few days if you want to visit this town being based in a very lively place. The hotel is placed in the "hot" quarter of sex shops and nightclubs but don'be neither scared nor impressed! It's bland indeed, there's no risk and the area is quite safe. When I chose this hotel I felt confident in what reported on the Lonely Planet guide and must confess that description of this place is really truthful. My husband and our two kids (10 & 8 years old) rent one of the "studios" of the Abri du Voyageur since we preferred to have a private bathroom (Hotel rooms have shared services). Despite the access to the studios can appear a bit disquieting (located in a more desert road at the rear of the Hotel), we were positively surprised by our little apartment: basic but spacious and clean, big bathroom and a very useful kitchenette that we used for breakfast and dinner . There was also an air conditioner (a bit noisy but necessary during those hot days in Montreal). The lady at the front desk was very nice , friendly and helpful taking care to inform us about all attractions, activities and Jazz festival in those days . The kids were so delighted when she offered them two beautiful pens as welcome present of the Hotel for its guests! Overall, I can say that if you are looking for tranquility far from noise, luxury & comfort, or any sort of amenities, don't choose l'Abri du Voyageur , but if you are looking for a simple and funny place, in a lively and nicely chaotic area in the heart of the town at cheap rates , absolutely go to l'Abri du Voyageur!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: JWPG
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend at the time booked this hotel for our Valentine's-week holiday. He booked everything and assured me it was going to be a great place. My biggest thing is cleanliness, and this place did not deliver. I was grossed out first by the washroom. We could hear people having sex (loud and clear) through the paper-thin walls. When we found out our stove in the kitchenette didn't work, we asked to be moved (we had to go down the hall, down the stairs, out the building, around the corner, up the stairs and waited to be buzzed in to the lobby. You know the hotel is in an unsafe area when you have to be buzzed in to the lobby during rush hour). We were given a new room a floor up from the first. So back around the corner, etc, etc. When we got up to the new room, the bathroom was just as grungy and the bed had pubic hairs in it. We again demanded a new room. The third room was down the hall from the original. When we tried the door, it had been chained from the inside and someone said "Hello?" from the dark. At that point I decided we were finding a new hotel. Being Valentine's Day, we had to stay there one night as there were no other rooms to be had at a reasonable rate. The night we slept at this place I kept all my daytime clothes on for fear of touching the linens - so much for a romantic Valentine's Day! The next day we booked into the Travelodge, which was slightly smaller, but had the cleanliness standard I expect. It was only $100 more for the week and still close to everything. And best of all, we weren't given an already-occupied room! Moral of the Story: DO Believe the bad reviews. They're true.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for travellers on budget..perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: shannonfelicia
Reviews.Content: i stay here everytime i visit montreal. the standard rooms are not the best if ur looking for quality bubecause of shared bathroom but its private once u get inside,. if youre looking for more upscale, you can try the studios in the same motel for more money, but theyre much much better. you get private washroom and kitchenette and room is much cleaner and newer looking. perfect location right in downtown, great helpful staff, and couldn't ask for more. i tried other low budget motels in mtl and this one is the best value for your dollar. feel free to contact me further for details.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Kyrastef
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recommendation from other travellers but we think they were confused about the location! The place is cheap and clean enough but not really much for relaxing in. Its in a red light area that during the day is OK but less inviting at night. I did not really feel safe in the hotel, fire trap and re-enforced doors make you wonder about prior events and that you should hatch an escape plan but all worked out OK. Oh the hole in the wall above the bed was a nice touch! The staff were friendly and helpful and its in walking distance to attractions. I wouldn't stay here again but if you want cheap, wont spend much time in your room and not too worried about the rowdy night life outside the window then maybe it would be OK. Otherwise Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: misty75
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent budget hotel. The rooms and common areas were spacious, clean , comfortable and well maintained. The shared bathrooms were also spacious and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is on the intersection of two major roads - one takes you to downtown, shopping areas and theatres. The other takes you to Chinatown, the old town and the Mount Royal district. Bedroom windows have double glazing so the noise wasn't a problem. Most of the tourist attractions are within walking distance. The hotel is in a small strip club area, but I (a female) wasn't harassed and I felt safe all the time. There is very good securtiy at the hotel - someone is onsite 24h a day, the front door was locked and the rooms had decent locks. Some of the floors are on a slight slope and there is no elevator, so if you have mobility problems you might find it easier to pay a bit extra and stay elsewhere. I enjoyed my stay here and woud defintely stay again when I return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Lindy22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at L'Abri Voyageur for three nights in November/December 2006, and don't plan on making that mistake again. First, the good: my third-floor room was spacious and clean. The hotel staff were very nice. The hotel is in a terrible area, but is walking distance away from most of Montreal's main sites (Old Montreal, the port, Chinatown, the Palais de Congres, etc). The bad: The neighbourhood is dangerous. Homeless people congregated on the steps of the hotel all the time and I had to step around them to get in. There are two nightclubs very close to the hotel, and the noise kept me up all night. The walls are very thin and I could hear everyone walking by and the person in the next room opening and closing his drawers, watching TV (my set didn't work because the reception was terrible), and talking on his cell phone. The bathrooms were gungy. There's two per floor. There's no elevator, so that's something to take into consideration if you want to stay here, and I also advise you to bring your own alarm clock if you want to be woken up on time. The hotel doesn't provide it.

Reviews.Title: “Quite an adventure”
Reviews.Author: SteveNM
Reviews.Content: Visited in May (single male traveler) and have to say that this really is a great bargain. I stayed in the suites section and had a large bedroom, kitchenette (with all appliances and conveniences - for those who want to shop and eat in occasionally), private bathroom and plenty of space. Portable air conditioner, TV included, no telephone and no internet capability in room - some kind of intercom was on wall but didn't have to use. Room was very clean and quiet for the most part. Not straightened up one day during my 9-day stay. Finding hotel was easy once you understand all the one-ways and maneuver the traffic (which is menacing). Arrival was hurried as parking in front of hotel is limited, then you walk up flight of stairs and quickly check in. Suites are around the coroner, and parking (private but very inexpensive) is a block behind. Once you get parked, you have to bring luggage back to the suites (roadwork going on and confusing entrance). I had a room on the 3rd floor and the climb was daunting. If you are elderly or have problems getting around, this is not the ideal setup for you. Parking was okay on weekends, however, weekday parking filled quickly with people who worked in the area. Sometimes have to leave key and have attendant park when space opens up. Not a big deal though. Conveniently located in "center" of town within walking distance to China Town, Old Town, and most "tourist" sites. Walking distance to all kinds of restaurants and major malls nearby. Yes, the area does look kinda seedy, but I felt pretty safe, and I wandered about all hours of day and night. Rental car came in handy because I wanted to visit Quebec, otherwise, the metro system and buses are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel With Personality!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is within easy walking distance of the convention centre and wonderful specialty shops. The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The rates are very reasonable. The hotel has personality. The room I stayed in had hard wood floors, an original oil painting, and an old bank vault for a clothes closet. The neighborhood has tatoo shops and sex shops, but felt very safe, and I was out until around mid-night fairly often. The odd night there was some noise when the bars let out, but that did not keep me awake. People concerned about night noise can ask for a room away from the street. I would give his hotel serious consideration if I was going to Montreal again. The hotel is one of the few travel bargains available.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: ElleEstPasBelleLaVie
Reviews.Content: First, the location: Next to a tatoo/piercing place, accross from a romantic(?) shop, and a street off several sex shop! It is however a block or so from the Desjardin complex which is nice and convenient. Second the room. We decided to go for the renovated studios with private bath.
